item.title: Risa add a quote by E. B. White
item.description: "You have been my friend. That in itself is a tremendous thing. I wove my webs for you because I liked you. After all, what's a life, anyway? We're born, we live a little while, we die. A spider's life can't help being something of a mess, with all this trapping and eating flies. By helping you, perhaps I was trying to lift up my life a trifle. Heaven knows anyone's life can stand a little of that." -- E. B. White

item.title: Risa add a quote by W. H. Auden
Risa add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "The ocean has been singing to me, and the song is that of our life together..." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Risa add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "The sea is emotion incarnate. It loves, hates, and weeps. It defies all attempts to capture it with words and rejects all shackles. No matter what you say about it, there is always that which you can't." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Risa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Risa add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "I love you more than there are stars in the sky and fish in the sea." -- Nicholas Sparks

item.title: Risa add a quote by Isak Dinesen
Risa add a quote by George Gordon Byron
item.description: "There is a pleasure in the pathless woods, There is a rapture on the lonely shore, There is society, where none intrudes, By the deep sea, and music in its roar: I love not man the less, but Nature more" -- George Gordon Byron

item.title: Risa add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "For whatever we lose (like a you or a me), It's always our self we find in the sea." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Risa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "What happened instead was that the tree fell in love with him and began to murmur fondly of the joy to be found in the eternal embrace of a red oak. "Always, always," it sighed, "faithful beyond any man's deserving. I will keep the color of your eyes when no other in the world remembers your name. There is no immortality but a tree's love." -- Peter S. Beagle
